TER.TERdecoder.BPEDecoder
Class AssembleSegments

java.lang.Object
  TER.TERdecoder.BPEDecoder.AssembleSegments

public class AssembleSegments
extends java.lang.Object

This class locates the decoded blocks inside the recovered image. Usage example:
  construct
  setParameters
  run
  get functions

Version:
1.2
Author:
Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)

True indicates that they are set otherwise false.

Constructor Detail

AssembleSegments

public AssembleSegments(float[][][] initialImage,
                        int[] numberOfInitialBlocks,
                        int zSize)
Constructor of the AssembleSegments class. Receives the image where blocks are added and the number of blocks that are contained in it.

Parameters:
initialImage - contains the image where blocks are added
numberOfInitialBlocks - indicates the number of blocks in the initial image, where new blocks are added

run

public void run()
         throws ParameterException
Put the segment into the recovered image, if it is required, the image size is modified to assemble the segment.

Throws:
ParameterException - if parameters are not set correctly.

resizeImage

private void resizeImage()
Compute the number of rows and columns required to add the segment, resize if needed and reallocate the blocks previously decoded

putBlockInSegment

public void putBlockInSegment(int block,
                              int channel,
                              int blockNumber)
                       throws ParameterException
Put the components in a block inside the transformed image.

Parameters:
block - indicates the number of block inside the segment
channel - indicates the channel where the block belongs
blockNumber - indicates the number of the segment inside the image
Throws:
ParameterException - when parameters are not compatible with adding the block

initLocationOfBlocks

private void initLocationOfBlocks()
In the case that the order of the blocks in the recovered image is not given, the default order is set.
